definition: to lay one's cards on the table
to spread out/vendor's stand
mahjong tile/playing card/game pieces/signboard/plate/tablet/medal/CL:片[pian4],個|个[ge4],塊|块[kuai4]

sentences.english: Management are seeking a show-down with the unions on the issue of illegal strikes.
sentences.chinese: 资方正在就非法罢工问题与工会摊牌。

sentences.english: The US throwed two atomic bombs for force a showdown during the WWII.
sentences.chinese: 二战期间美国投下两颗原子弹迫使对方摊牌。

sentences.english: “Grandpa, ” I finally said to him recently, “you are 87 years old.
sentences.chinese: 最近我终于向他摊牌，“爷爷，你已经87岁了。

sentences.english: Today, I decided to tell my roommate how I really feel about her after a rude remark she made.
sentences.chinese: 今天我受不了室友的粗暴行为了，于是跟她摊牌。

sentences.english: He told him that he had three days to hightail it or there'd turn into a showdown.
sentences.chinese: 艾顿通告他有三天的时间逃命，否则就是摊牌。

sentences.english: Eventually the National Guard is called in for a final showdown with the terrorizing rabbits.
sentences.chinese: 最终，是所谓的国民卫队中的最后摊牌的恐吓作用。

sentences.english: After having submitted to humiliation for many years, Tom finally had it out with his boss.
sentences.chinese: 忍气吞声了多年后，汤姆最终和他的老板摊牌了。

sentences.english: Come late summer or early fall, a showdown between the President and Congress could be in the cards.
sentences.chinese: 到夏末秋初，总统和国会之间的摊牌就要来了。

sentences.english: Xu Wenqiang and Ding showdown break.
sentences.chinese: 许文强与丁力摊牌决裂。

definition: to illuminate/to open up (a topic)
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
honest/forthcoming/to confess
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
to have a falling out/to have a big argument
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
to admit defeat/to give in/to acknowledge a mistake/to apologize/to be amenable to persuasion
variant of 開誠布公|开诚布公[kai1 cheng2 bu4 gong1]
lit. deal sincerely and fairly (idiom); frank and open-minded/plain speaking/Let's talk frankly and openly between ourselves./to put one's cards on the table
lit. quick sword cuts through tangled hemp (idiom); decisive action in a complex situation/cutting the Gordian knot
(of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate
hopelessly muddled/impossible to unravel
to show one's hand/to lay one's cards on the table
to make friends again/to renew old cordial relations
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4
